questions.question: What does the reflection coefficient (Γ) represent?

answers.a: The ratio of input to output voltage
answers.c: The ratio of reflected to incident voltage
answers.d: The power transferred to the load

explanations.a: Incorrect – this describes gain or attenuation.
explanations.b: Incorrect – return loss represents signal loss.
explanations.d: Incorrect – Γ does not represent power transfer.

questions.question: What does a VSWR of 1 indicate?

explanations.a: Incorrect – reflection is zero when VSWR = 1.
explanations.b: Incorrect – short circuits lead to infinite VSWR.
explanations.d: Incorrect – open circuits also lead to high VSWR.

questions.question: Why do standing waves occur on a transmission line?

answers.a: Due to power loss in the line
answers.b: Due to reflections from impedance mismatch

explanations.a: Incorrect – loss causes attenuation, not standing waves.
explanations.d: Incorrect – amplification doesn’t cause standing waves.

questions.question: What is the unit of return loss?

explanations.a: Incorrect – Ohm is a unit of resistance.
explanations.b: Incorrect – Power is measured in watts.
explanations.c: Correct – Return loss is in decibels.
